cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of document dating, which involves tasks such as document retrieval, summarization, and event detection. These tasks are typically associated with the fields of natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR), which are covered by the cs.CL and cs.IR sub-categories of arXiv CS. The paper proposes a deep learning approach based on graph convolutional networks (GCNs), which are a popular tool in machine learning for dealing with graph-structured data. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.LG (machine learning) and cs.AI (artificial intelligence), which cover topics related to deep learning and neural networks. Finally, the paper's focus on temporal structures and time-based inference may also make it relevant to the cs.SI (social and information networks) sub-category, which deals with the analysis of temporal and dynamic networks.
